TextView.android:text: Control, this is approach, Go ahead estimates.
Estimate, United 415, A320, from RPVB, estimates Ilayma at time 0830, FL150.
>\tThen Rundown your estimates from LAIYA to VOR.
- RPLL - is the destination airport (Manila Airport).
- To get the estimates per reporting points the formula is:\n\t\tDistance per rep. point / 5.
- Then, add it on the given time over the first reporting point until to the last.
Approach, this is Tower, Go Ahead
Arrival estimate, United 415 an Airbus 320 from RPVB, estimates Manila VOR at 0843, your control on final.
- In this case, 0830 is the given time over the first reporting point, we get the 36 over palig using the formula.
- If the answer is not a whole number, you always have to make it whole number, so round-up is a must.
Estimate, United 415, descending FL150, approaching ilayma, Release.
- Once the ACC releases the aircraft to you, as an Approach Controller, you have to record the time of release, in this case the 25 is the time of release message (in minutes).
Approach, United 415, over Ilayma, Passing FL200 for FL 150.
United 415, Manila Approach, Proceed Manila VOR via ilayma, Palig, Morac, expect ILS Approach RWY 06, QNH 1010, descend 110.
Roger. To proceed Manila VOR via ilayma, Palig, Morac, expect ILS Approach runway 06, QNH1010, descend 110.
- Be mindful of time when the pilot/aircraft initiate a contact with you. In this situation, 29 is the time when the Aircraft called.
- When aircraft reports its position over reporting point, fill in the appropriate boxes (Actual Time Over reporting point).
- When aircraft is cleared of traffic, descend to a lower altitude subject to your departing traffic.
Clearance for Commencement for ILS Approach
Approach, United 415 just passed Morac a minute ago
United 415, descend 6000, cleared ILS Approach runway 06. Report commencing over the VOR at 6000.
Roger. will Descend 6000, cleared ILS Approach Runway 06. Will Commence over the VOR at 6000
Approach, united 415, commencing over the VOR.
- 41 (1st Box) is the time (in minutes) when approach clearance is given. (Cleared ILS approach).
- 41 (2nd Box, Top Row) - is the actual time over the VOR.
- 41 (2nd Box, Bottom Row) is the time when the aircraft reported commencing over the VOR. Basically just same with the actual time over the VOR.
Tower, this is Approach, United 415 commencing over the VOR your control on final.
- 0842 is the actual time when approach transfer the control to tower.
- 0842 (42 on 3rd Box, Top Row) is the actual time aircraft reported on base turn.
- 0843 (43 on 3rd Box, Bottom Row) is the actual time when the aircraft reported on final.
- Remember that actual time, may vary depends on the time that the aircraft/pilot initiate a contact with you.
